Based on the search results, I found information about Claude API response types. Here's what I discovered:

## Claude API Response Types

The Claude Messages API returns responses with a specific structure that includes fields like "id", "type", "role", "content", "stop_reason", "stop_sequence", and "usage".

### Response Structure

A typical response includes a content array with objects that have a "type" field (such as "text") and corresponding content. For example:

```json
{
  "id": "msg_018gCsTGsXkYJVqYPxTgDHBU",
  "type": "message",
  "role": "assistant",
  "content": [
    {
      "type": "text",
      "text": "Sure, I'd be happy to provide..."
    }
  ],
  "stop_reason": "end_turn",
  "stop_sequence": null,
  "usage": {
    "input_tokens": 30,
    "output_tokens": 309
  }
}
```

### Content Types

Each message must have a role and content, where content may be either a single string or an array of content blocks with specific types. Using a string is shorthand for an array of one content block of type "text".

For multimodal prompts that combine images and text, you specify the modalities in the content input field, with content blocks of type "image" and "text".

### Typed Schemas

When using JSON output format, message schemas are strictly typed, and the types are available in the Anthropic SDKs, making programmatic parsing of responses robust and reliable.

The API documentation provides comprehensive details on these response structures in the Messages API reference.

Multi-level logging plus live onMessage/onToolUse callbacks give deep, CLI-compatible observability.","url":"https://github.com/instantlyeasy/claude-code-sdk-ts"},{"title":"CLAUDE MD TypeScript","url":"https://github.com/ruvnet/claude-flow/wiki/CLAUDE-MD-TypeScript"},{"title":"A Comprehensive Guide to the Claude Code SDK","url":"https://apidog.com/blog/a-comprehensive-guide-to-the-claude-code-sdk/"},{"title":"@instantlyeasy/claude-code-sdk-ts - npm","url":"https://www.npmjs.com/package/@instantlyeasy/claude-code-sdk-ts"},{"title":"GitHub - s-soroosh/claude-code-js: Claude Code SDK for Javascript & Typescript","url":"https://github.com/s-soroosh/claude-code-js"},{"title":"Convert Claude command integration to TypeScript · Issue #304 · ruvnet/claude-flow","url":"https://github.com/ruvnet/claude-flow/issues/304"},{"title":"Claude Code | Claude","url":"https://claude.com/product/claude-code"},{"title":"Cooking with Claude Code: The Complete Guide - Sid Bharath","url":"https://www.siddharthbharath.com/claude-code-the-complete-guide/"},{"title":"@botanicastudios/claude-code-sdk-ts - npm","url":"https://www.npmjs.com/package/@botanicastudios/claude-code-sdk-ts"}]

I found information about TypeScript types and definitions for Claude Code CLI packages. Here's what I discovered:

## Official TypeScript SDK

The official types are exported from @anthropic/claude-code-sdk and can be used for type-safe tool interactions. The official TypeScript SDK reference documentation shows:

- Complete API reference for the Claude Code TypeScript SDK, including all functions, types, and interfaces.
- The primary function for interacting with Claude Code creates an async generator that streams messages as they arrive.

Key type definitions include:
- **ToolInput types**: Union of all built-in tool input types (AgentInput, BashInput, FileEditInput, FileReadInput, FileWriteInput, etc.)
- **ToolOutput types**: Union of all tool output types (TaskOutput, BashOutput, EditOutput, ReadOutput, WriteOutput, etc.)
- **SyncHookJSONOutput**: Types for hook event handling with permission decisions

## Unofficial Community SDKs

There are also community-maintained TypeScript packages:

1. **@instantlyeasy/claude-code-sdk-ts** - Unofficial TypeScript SDK for Claude Code - the powerful CLI tool for interacting with Claude. It provides a fluent, chainable API with comprehensive TypeScript support.

2. **claude-code-js** (s-soroosh) - A JavaScript/TypeScript SDK that allows developers to programmatically interact with Claude Code, enabling AI-powered software engineering capabilities in their applications.(no content)TypeScript definitions provide complete type information for all these packages.

Based on the search results, I found information about Claude API response types, including `tool_use` and `text` content blocks. Here's what I found:

## Claude API Response Types

Content generated by the Claude model is returned as an array of content blocks, each of which has a type that determines its shape.

### Content Block Types

There are three types of content: text, tool_use and image.

### Tool Use Content Blocks

If you include tools in your API request, the model may return tool_use content blocks that represent the model's use of those tools.(no content)You can then run those tools using the tool input generated by the model and then optionally return results back to the model using tool_result content blocks.

### Text Content Blocks

Using a string is shorthand for an array of one content block of type "text".

### Response Structure

The conversational role of the generated message will always be "assistant".

### Claude Code Output Formats

For the Claude Code CLI tool specifically, you can use --output-format with --print mode to specify response structure: text for human reading, json for programmatic processing, or stream-json for real-time data handling.

The search results provide information about the Claude Messages API response structure, where responses contain content blocks that can be of type `text`, `tool_use`, or `image`, allowing the model to generate different types of content based on the request and available tools.
